emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: Systems capable of autonomously developing, testing, and deploying software applications with minimal human oversight.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduction in coding errors, increased productivity, potential job displacement for entry-level developers, need for new educational paradigms.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires trust in AI systems, regulatory frameworks for AI in software development, and acceptance by the developer community.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuralink Expansion
emerging_technologies.description: Enhanced brain-computer interfaces that allow for more complex interactions like thought-controlled devices and direct human-to-human communication.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Privacy concerns, ethical debates over enhancement vs. therapy, potential for cognitive inequality.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, public perception, and integration with existing technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography
emerging_technologies.description: Cryptographic algorithms designed to withstand attacks from quantum computers.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ensures long-term security of digital transactions and data, essential for blockchain and secure communications.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for standardization, transition from current systems, and global adoption.

emerging_technologies.name: Carbon Capture and Utilization
emerging_technologies.description: Technologies for capturing carbon dioxide from industrial emissions and converting it into useful products like building materials or fuels.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Combats climate change, promotes circular economy, potential economic benefits from carbon markets.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Economic incentives, regulatory support, and technological scalability.

emerging_technologies.name: Space-Based Solar Power
emerging_technologies.description: Solar energy collected by satellites in space and beamed back to Earth to provide clean, continuous power.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could significantly reduce reliance on fossil fuels, geopolitical implications for energy distribution, and space law considerations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological feasibility, economic viability, and international cooperation.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Urban Traffic Management
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that optimize traffic flow in cities, reducing congestion and improving transport efficiency.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in major urban centers with supportive infrastructure.

mainstream_technologies.name: Fully Autonomous Electric Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Self-driving cars that operate without human intervention, enhancing safety and mobility.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Commercially available with widespread regulatory acceptance in developed countries.

epoch_themes.theme: The Rise of AI in Daily Life
epoch_themes.description: AI becomes ubiquitous, influencing everything from personal assistants to autonomous systems.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift in job markets, redefinition of human-AI collaboration, privacy issues.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased demand for AI education, ethical AI frameworks, and international AI governance.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on environmental sustainability and the expansion of human presence in space.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Reduction in carbon footprint, new energy paradigms, potential for new industries in space.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for green technologies, space tourism, and exploration initiatives.
